abstract.text: An object that enhances the text display capabilities of a cell.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: class adds to the text display capabilities of the
class by allowing you to set the color of both the text and its background. You can also specify whether the cell draws its background at all.
All of the methods declared by this class are also declared by the
objects to draw and edit text. The
property, appear in the text field cell if the actual string is
or an empty string. They’re drawn in gray on the cell and aren’t archived in the “pre-10.2” nib format.
you must implement the designated initializers

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
An active area inside a control.
A mechanism for displaying text or images in a view object without the overhead of a full
subclass.
Returns an NSCell object initialized with the specified string and set to have the cell’s default menu.
The user interface of a combo box.
A component of a path.
The programmatic interface for text fields that are used for text-based searches.
A text field whose value is hidden from the user.
An object that a table header view uses to draw the content of the column headers.
Text the user can select or edit to send an action message to a target when the user presses the Return key.
The style of bezel the text field displays.
An object that enhances the text display capabilities of a cell.
An array of locale identifiers that represent the allowed input sources when the text field has the keyboard focus.
The color of the cell’s background.
The bezel style to use when drawing the text field.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the cell draws its background color.
Initializes a text field cell from data in the provided unarchiver.
Initializes a text field cell that displays the specified string.
The placeholder text for the cell, specified as an attributed string.
The placeholder text for the cell, specified as a plain text string.
Allows the cell to set up the field editor’s attributes before editing begins.
Directs the cell’s associated field editor to post text change notifications.
The color to use to draw the cell’s text.
A text field cell subclass that enables tokenized editing of an array of objects.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
